He is affectionate, follows his person closely, and wants to be near his humans at all times. However, Axel is an anxious dog and is struggling significantly in a busy household environment. Since coming into my care it has become clear that his needs are beyond what I can provide, and this decision is being made purely for his welfare. Behaviour & Challenges: ‚Ä¢ Fearful of other dogs ‚Ä¢ Very sensitive to noise, movement, and change ‚Ä¢ Likely suffering from anxiety-related marking / stress toileting ‚Ä¢ Not coping in a busy or unpredictable home environment What Axel Needs: Axel must go to: ‚Ä¢ A very calm, low-stimulus home ‚Ä¢ Ideally adult-only ‚Ä¢ No other dogs (or an extremely experienced handler who can manage separation safely) ‚Ä¢ Someone with experience of anxious or reactive dogs ‚Ä¢ A home with hard flooring initially ‚Ä¢ Someone willing and able to work with a qualified behaviourist ‚Ä¢ Time, patience, and emotional consistency He is not suitable for: ‚Ä¢ First-time dog owners ‚Ä¢ Busy households ‚Ä¢ Homes with lots of visitors ‚Ä¢ Homes expecting a house-trained dog immediately Important Notes: Axel is not a ‚Äúbad dog‚Äù. His behaviours appear to be driven by anxiety and overwhelm, not spite or lack of intelligence. In the right environment, with the right support, he has the potential to settle and improve. This is a heart-breaking decision and I am committed to ensuring Axel goes to the right home, not just the quickest one.

title: Our beautiful girl needs a new home
description: It is with deepest regret that we are having to rehome our beautiful Nala. It has nothing to do with Nala it is the fact that is a sudden change in the house with my illness and at the moment she‚Äôs spending more time in her crate since she is out with the family and it is no life for her she deserves the absolute world. PLEASE READ CAREFULLY BELOW!!!! Now there are things that you should know going to be very honest with you she needs to go to a home without other animals especially dogs and cats. She will go for them when she gets walked every day twice a day she has to have a muzzle on, but if someone something goes for her, she will snap back now we‚Äôve had her for 2 1/2 years. She has never once growled at any of us let alone bite or nip. I have four children here but when someone lets her out to take for a walk or anything else she is extremely excitable so younger children I wouldn‚Äôt recommend because she will knock them over. She gets very excited. She jumps up and then she lays on the floor and she waits to have her belly rubbed and she should stay there all day laying on her back, just waiting for people to come and rub her belly, We have four cats Adult cats they are older and we didn‚Äôt know about cat situation when we got Nala or any other information about Nala but if to let Nara out and to take for a walk, we have to put all four cats into another room to let Nala out so she can go for a walk or go and play in the garden then let the cats back out so they can roam around the house cause they house cats and then same again bringing her in. She can‚Äôt be let off her lead at the park. I have tried three dog groomers, two of which rang me within 20 minutes of dropping her off because she was going crazy cause obviously though other dogs in the background so I‚Äôve had to Fatch her the last lady she does it after all the other dogs have been collected She has recently been defleed and wormed. Now the price reflects on how comfort we are that Nala will be looked after she is very loving. She will try and sit on your lap and think that she‚Äôs a baby but she‚Äôs not. She‚Äôs extremely heavy, we want a family or a a couple perhaps someone that‚Äôs at home all day because she will be able to be out of her crate. I wouldn‚Äôt have to move her to get the cat out or anything cause she would make excellent company. I got diagnosed with MS and it has progressed quicker than we thought. I‚Äôm currently bed ridden and my husband is having to do everything and Nala is being left alone too much and it‚Äôs just not fair and it‚Äôs breaking our hearts. Even the children have agreed and she loved by so many. also to make sure she goes to a good Home ‚ù§Ô∏è we would possibly do a Home ‚ù§Ô∏è visit so we know that she‚Äôs going to be loved and have everything that not our love needs thank you for reading and hopefully there will be a loving Home ‚ù§Ô∏è. ** please note anyone who starts the message with ‚Äú I‚Äôll give you ¬£100‚Äù. or any other amount you will NOT get a reply it means you have no interest in taking her to a lovely home or serious about what‚Äôs been written **

title: 6yr old German Shepherd
description: Meet Aslan. He's an intact 6.5yr old male german shepherd whom I've owned since 8 week pup so this is incredibly hard. He is a massive boy! Unfortunatley due to circumstances, safety and ensuring the best quality of life is received we are looking for somebody who will love Aslan like us! MUST BE AN ONLY PET/NO CHILD HOME - SIMILAR BREED EXPERIENCE OR TRAINING EXPERIENCE WILL BE REQUIRED TO SUIT HIM. If you have high energy drive dog ownership experience or you have good training knowledge and can provide a calm environment then you may be perfect for Aslan. He is highly intelligent loves to run and chase his ball for hours, very ball driven for training and calm and cuddly on his own! He is crate trained & never disruptive or destroys in the house at all. He absolutely loves his food too! A long walk or run will only get him sleeping for a short while so he needs some one able to give him a lot of daily time. Aslan has been anxious since a pup which we worked on however as our house gets busier and having to downsize home it appears to be taking a toll on him. He is dog reactive so is kept separate from our other dog which means his freedom is being compromised too. He gets on with our female dog but when she gets hyper it triggers him and same with the kids he is fine with them often prefers to play ball with them but when they get loud or hyper he starts pacing in circles which is his tell sign or barking/yapping. Because of this he is best as an only pet & without children for safety precautions. Sadly we are having to make the decision to rehome him so he can thrive or keep him & his needs possibly continue to get worse as after trying different strategies and trying to manage our house is too much for him to handle and be comfortable in. He needs a sole person or a couple who can dedicate time, love, patience and the right training and he will reward you with so much. Despite his issues he really is the best boy struggling to navigate with a lot of love to give back! Its not a light hearted decision and we won't be rushing untill we find the best home for him which we hope any genuine interest will understand. Please get in touch for more information. We do not want to profit from him however would like to make sure he goes to a genuine home. If this is proven all payment will be returned as we just want the best for him.

title: Black German Shepherd
description: *OPEN TO OFFERS* This is Atlas, he is a 3 year old, gorgeous male. He is mostly black with brown on the back of the legs. He is all up to date with injections/flea and worming. He is neutered and microchipped. He is a friendly dog, but he has no idea what personal space is, he loves to snuggle into necks and follow you everywhere. He is very loyal to familiar people. He‚Äôs a very clever dog but he does need extensive training in some areas so I‚Äôd rather him go to a home who has the time for that and who has experience with the breed. He has grown up around a small child and a cat and he‚Äôs had no issues with them. He does however have issues in other areas. He is dog reactive on walks, he barks at them and pulls to be over to say hello, he‚Äôs never snapped or shown aggressive behaviour towards them, he‚Äôs just a very curious dog. If a stranger is walking near, he will try to jump up at them if they‚Äôre close enough. If you leave anything lying around, he will find a way to get into it. (Bin bags, any kind of plate/cup in the sink etc even if he‚Äôs just been fed.) German shepherds are a very vocal breed, and Atlas is no stranger to barking if someone walks past the window, gets out of a car on the street etc. I need him to go to a home who has the time, patience and space for him to thrive and where his needs are met. If interested please get in touch.

title: 1st generation standard size labradoodle puppies
description: Update- 2 girls and 3 boys remaining. The puppies have just turned 6 weeks old and so unbelievably cute! Mum (Dotty) is a beautiful, fun, loyal, kind, affectionate family fox red labrador. We have an autistic son and by default she has become a kind of therapy dog to him. She is so tolerant, eager to please and loves life. Health tested, with a five-generation pedigree, we could not ask for a dog with a better nature. Kennel Club name: Costalaporia Eleanor BVA/KC Elbow Dysplasia: Left= 0, Right=0 BVA/KC Hip Dysplasia: Left= 2, Right= 4, Total=6 BVA/KC/ISDS Eye Scheme= Unaffected DNA-EIC Hereditary Clear DNA -CNM Hereditary Clear DNA-SD2 Hereditary Clear DNA- prdc- PRA Clear Dad (Jake) is an extremely handsome standard size poodle. He has a lovely, kind temperament. He is also health tested with a five-generation pedigree. Kennel Club name: Abergwellan Jakey BVA/KC Elbow Dysplasia: Left= 0, Right=0 BVA/KC Hip Dysplasia: Left= 6, Right= 4, Total=10 BVA/KC/ISDS Eye Scheme= Unaffected It is important to note that we are not full-time puppy breeders. We are just a normal family with children and other animals, living on a smallholding in the Scottish Borders. We love the experience of having a litter and you can be assured that these puppies will have the best start to their lives. We had this litter so that we can keep one ourselves so there‚Äôs a lot of excitement in our household! Puppies will be exposed to lots of household noises (the TV, the hoover, the blender etc), brought up with children (we have 4 children), will be well socialised and used to being around other dogs and animals (we have sheep and hens). They will very much be in the centre of our house for their first few weeks with us, living in our country kitchen with people around at all times. They are showered with love and cuddles almost constantly. The pups will be ready to leave for their new homes from the beginning of February following their eight-week final vet checks, vaccinations and microchips. They will join their new homes with the following: ‚Ä¢ Microchip and information pack ‚Ä¢ Vaccination card & worming record ‚Ä¢ Lifetime support and advice ‚Ä¢ A contract of sale for your peace of mind Given the unfortunate rise of dog thefts, we would like to point out that someone is at home 24 hours a day with the puppies and our grounds are covered by CCTV. No details of our address will be given out for visiting until we have had a conversation with you and we are happy you are genuine. Please get in touch if you are interested!

description: 5 Star beautiful and rare, all chocolate and chocolate and tan miniature dachshunds from a licensed breeder, home care environment. Both mother and father have excellent temperaments, are not lead reactive or noisy. Neither parents suffer with separation anxiety, common with the breed. title: Jack/Pom/Chi Puppy Crossbreed for sale
description: ** Please only contact if you're serious please. I've only had time wasters so far** Ares is a 18 month old puppy, who I've had since he was 8 weeks old. He's full of personality and life, affectionate and very curious. He is a darling dog, and it pains me to have to rehome him, but there are a few behavioural issues that I've tried to manage myself, but am not making headway. Ares is my first dog, and I can't afford a trainer. In short, I'm not experienced enough with dogs to provide him with what he needs. He barks a lot, particularly for attention, so I've been leaving the room when he does and paying him attention when he's quiet, which has helped slightly, but not solved the issue. He wants to be outside constantly, and I don't have a garden myself. Due to having no garden, he is not fully potty-trained. He knows to go outside, but if I'm not home to let him out, he will still soil indoors, and not hold it like he should. He has a lot of energy and needs to go out for walks as often as possible. What he needs in a future owner: He needs someone who has experience with dogs and training, and I know he would benefit from the mental stimulation that comes with the training. He needs someone who has a garden or access to an outdoor space as much as possible. He needs someone who has a more active lifestyle than me, who will be able to take him with them as much as possible. I really am quite sad that I have to admit that I can't provide him what he needs, and I have given it my all, but it is now affecting my mental health, and I know there must be someone out there who can do a better job than me. He is up to date with vaccinations, microchipped, and has been defleaed and dewormed recently. He comes with a crate, harness, flexi-lead, coat, toys, remaining food (Butchers, which is his preference and other foods give him a bad stomach), months of worming and flea medication, scratch box for his nails and other accessories.

description: From a litter of four Pembrokeshire Welsh Corgi pups, we have one gorgeous, red-and-white male pup available, who is of show quality. Our sweet boy has beautiful markings and a sweet, friendly, playful character. He is not at risk of DM, PRA or vWD by parentage, the parents have full genetic reports done. The mother is an adorable, lovely-natured dam. Her character is very gentle and sweet, and she's a little homebody, never straying far from home, and always looking for hugs. Her 5 generation pedigree has 10 champions: Champion of International Beauty, Champions of Ireland, Netherlands, Russia, Belarus with ancestry from Hillberry, USA. and Spancihill, Ireland. Our male is loving, highly intelligent and with lots of energy. He is a KC registered stud after winning 1st place at Belfast Dog Show. He is our companion outdoors accompanying us everywhere, and patrolling the area and enjoys hiking. He's friends with our horses, and will go to fetch them from the field when requested. His instinct is still there, as he likes cows and goes to greet them, but does not chase them. Thankfully he has no interest in sheep! He has 10 champions in Ireland, Netherlands and USA (in his 5 generation pedigree) and comes from a collaboration between Balletcor (Wales), and Marshmere (Ireland), with ancestry from the renowned Stormerbanks in USA. He has won 1st place in the many Kennel Club Shows and Agricultural shows. You can see him in the last photo. Both parents can be viewed. Pup will be pedigree registered with IKC (in Ireland), vaccinated, microchipped, with flea and worming up to date. A lifetime of support is available too!

description: Only 5 extraordinary Tibetan Mastiff puppies have remaining and are now two weeks old with their eyes open and walking around. they already have that majestic charm of tiny lions ‚Äî fluffy, captivating, and impossible to ignore. This is a rare opportunity to welcome a puppy from proven champion bloodlines, combining the best of Sorsha‚Äôs full Lion Type and Bruno‚Äôs powerful Tiger Type. Each puppy promises size, beauty, and a temperament that will make them a lifelong companion. Gentle Giants with Family-Friendly Temperament Both Sorsha (dam) and Bruno (sire) are calm, loving, and deeply affectionate. Despite their impressive size, they are used to children, highly sociable, and confident without being aggressive. We expect their puppies to inherit the same gentle, loyal nature, making them perfect for families prepared for a very large, majestic dog. Size, Presence & the ‚ÄúLion Effect‚Äù Tibetan Mastiffs are not just big ‚Äî they are truly captivating. Adults reach 60‚Äì70kg+, with heavy bone, broad heads, thick coats, and that unmistakable lion-like presence. People literally stop in their tracks. It‚Äôs almost impossible to walk one without hearing: ‚ÄúOh my God‚Ä¶ it looks like a lion!‚Äù They draw attention wherever they go ‚Äî commanding admiration without being excitable, bold yet gentle, captivating and unforgettable. Meet the Puppies This litter is already showing incredible potential, with coats ranging from deep black to brilliant gold, and markings hinting at their future manes. While we can‚Äôt guarantee that all will have the full lion-like mane, each puppy will develop a beautiful coat, and some will have especially impressive manes as they mature around the 8- to 12-week mark. Each puppy is unique: ‚Ä¢ Black male ‚Äì very large, striking white ‚Äúnumber 7‚Äù marking on chest, white-tipped paws, early eyebrow markings ‚Ä¢ Black female ‚Äì largest female, white chest markings, white-tipped paws, beautiful tan eyebrow accents ‚Ä¢ Black male ‚Äì smaller, white star chest marking, white-tipped paws, extremely affectionate ‚Ä¢ Small black female ‚Äì tiny, mostly black, sweet and delicate ‚Ä¢ Mid-sized black female ‚Äì small white chest marking, shiny coat, very affectionate ‚Ä¢ Large gold female ‚Äì rich, bright golden coat like her mother, likely long-haired lion type ‚Ä¢ Gold female ‚Äì slightly darker gold, beautifully shaded coat, large and striking Coats, markings, and manes will continue to develop as they grow, with some puppies potentially showcasing particularly impressive lion-like manes around the 8- to 12-week mark. Health, Care & Responsible Homes These puppies are raised in a loving, hands-on environment, with thorough veterinary checks to ensure they are healthy and well-socialized. We are committed to finding responsible, loving homes for these gentle giants. These dogs are playful, loyal, and family-oriented, but they do require owners who are prepared for their impressive size and unique needs. Secure Your Puppy To ensure these puppies are placed in genuine, loving homes, we ask for a non-refundable deposit. This measure is not about money; it‚Äôs about ensuring that each puppy goes to a home that truly understands and will cherish them. We take this responsibility seriously, and the deposit helps us prioritize committed families. Please only enquire if you are ready to provide a lifelong, loving home. Registration The puppies are offered as companion pets, not show dogs. They are not automatically Kennel Club registered, but registration can be provided upon request for an additional fee. Serious Enquiries Only This is a rare litter from champion bloodlines. Serious enquiries only ‚Äî these puppies won‚Äôt be available for long, and we are committed to finding the best homes possible.

description: ONO Health test & hip scored parents. Ready to leave now! X Deluxe puppy pack included with lots of extras included. Our lovely girl has had a litter of 5 pups red/brown tri rough coat. We have 1 chocolate tri rough-coat Border Collie pups available: 1 boy Ready to leave 15th January. Mum and pups are raised in our family home in Wales. He is Forthglade fed, handled daily, and used to normal household sounds from day one. He is toilet trained with very few, if any accidents. Confident using the stairs, knows tricks (sit, down, roll, and touch) These pups could suit either a family home or a working farm / agility home: they have the potential for either path. Both boys are so lovely and gentle, they love a cuddle and playing with their litter mates. We take socialisation seriously and strive for puppies to leave our home confident, curious, playful and ready to adapt to life in their new homes. Border Collies are intelligent so we make sure they get the right mental stimulation early on. Our pups will be well loved, regularly handled, gently introduced to new experiences, and exposed to sensory challenges. They will be well socialised and introduced to as many sounds and experiences as possible: household noises (vacuuming, music, etc), and other animals including cats, rabbits, reptiles and farm animals. They will have regular play inside, experience the world outside, have moments of independence, and will begin toilet training and basic commands whilst they are with us. Mum and Dad both have a friendly and lovely temperament, are hip scored and health tested. Both parents are on the smaller side for Border Collies, so we expect the puppies to be similarly sized. -MUM- Mum is our family dog ‚Äî she comes from a local working sheep farm line and has herding in her blood. We live on a sheep farm ourselves, but we chose not to work her. She has enjoyed home agility throughout her life. Hip scored 5:5 Adult weight 17kg Collie Eye Anomaly: carrier Glaucoma & Goniodysgenesis: clear Cobalamin Malabsorption: clear MDR1 / Ivermectin Sensitivity: carrier Neuronal Ceroid Lipofuscinosis: clear Raine Syndrome: clear Sensory Neuropathy: clear Trapped Neutrophil Syndrome: clear -DAD- Dad is a premium friendly stud, raised in a family home with other dogs. He is KC and ISDS registered and is known for siring healthy, good-temperament, cuddly offspring who do well in agility, fly-ball and obedience. Hip scored 15:8 Adult weight 20kg Collie Eye Anomaly: clear Glaucoma & Goniodysgenesis: clear Cobalamin Malabsorption: clear MDR1 / Ivermectin Sensitivity: clear Neuronal Ceroid Lipofuscinosis: clear Raine Syndrome: clear Sensory Neuropathy: clear Trapped Neutrophil Syndrome: clear This level of health testing and care is not common in most collies advertised. Before leaving they will have: ‚Äì Vaccinations (DHPPI ‚Äî not L4 or L2 due to discontinued L2 and frequent negative L4 reactions in puppies and dogs) ‚Äì Full vet health check ‚Äì Microchip ‚Äì Regular worming ‚Äì Forthglade puppy food ‚Äì Items with mum & siblings scent ‚Äì Important documentation ‚Äì Deluxe puppy pack Deluxe Puppy Pack Includes items such as: ‚Äì Puppy pads ‚Äì collar and lead ‚Äì Interactive puzzle slow feeder ‚Äì Blanket with mum and siblings scent ‚Äì Mix of toys This is just a small example of what we will give you, there‚Äôs plenty more included. If you'd like a full breakdown just ask, or you‚Äôre welcome to let it be a lovely surprise on collection. Viewings & Leaving Dates Viewings welcome from 9th December when pups are 5 weeks old. Puppies will be ready to leave from 15th January, giving them valuable extra time with mum. A slightly longer stay helps them develop stronger social skills, independence, and smoother transitions into their new homes. A note on the festive season A puppy could make a lovely surprise or a heart-warming way to start the New Year, but please remember a dog is for life, not just for the festive season. These pups will need commitment, time and love every day, and we want them to go to homes ready for a lifelong family member. Before leaving for their forever homes, we have a contract in place and ask for a home check (via satisfactory video/photos) plus a short questionnaire to ensure each puppy is a good match for your family and lifestyle. Please don‚Äôt hesitate to get in touch for more information or any questions. We‚Äôre happy to send photos and videos as they grow. We take daily clips and share updates so you can stay part of their journey from the start. We‚Äôre always happy to stay in touch after they leave, and we‚Äôre available for ongoing advice or questions at any time.

title: Our site will be temporarily unavailable between 01:00 and 04:00 on the 21st. We apologise for any inconvenience.
description: Hello. We are looking for a very special home for our 2.5 year-old castrated Standard Schnauzer. He is a really good dog in so many ways: he is loving with us, intelligent, enjoys agility in the garden and is great at close heelwork, doing tricks etc. (see the videos of him doing agility in the garden and working on obedience moves in the hall). He‚Äôs also a good watchdog as he sounds the alarm when anyone approaches the house ‚Äì though that can be annoying. At this stage, I expect you are asking what the problem is. Unfortunately, he does not get on with our 7-year-old cockapoo bitch and given the size difference we cannot risk any confrontation meaning that we live day to day with them in separate areas of the house, sharing our time with each of them. We are now at the stage of thinking that this isn‚Äôt sustainable. If that were the only issue, I‚Äôm sure re-homing him would be easy, but it isn‚Äôt just our other dog that he doesn‚Äôt get on with. He is also unpredictable with both strange dogs and people. He has never bitten anybody, but we take no risks and muzzle him when he is in public. When we have visitors, we put him in his crate only letting him out when he is quiet and settled ‚Äì but it can still be very off-putting as he will not let strangers stroke him. We‚Äôve soldiered on with him because we love and care about him, but we have to admit that he really isn't the right dog for our family. I think he would really suit someone who has time for him, has no other dog, and wants a constant companion to be with them most of the time. He is crate trained, muzzle trained (though he doesn‚Äôt like it), fully vaccinated and flea treated. He‚Äôs a complicated dog and not friendly to everyone. It'll take him some time to accept you and no doubt he'll be a nightmare until he settles but he is such a special dog that if you have the time, understanding and patience, he will be a friend for life.

description: We are delighted to announce the availability of nine beautiful Labrador Retriever puppies, now looking for their forever homes. The litter consists of four males and five females, all of whom are thriving and developing wonderfully. I now have 4 girls and 3 boys available The puppies are being raised in a loving family home and will continue to receive exceptional care as they grow. Regular updates and additional photographs will be available, and you are welcome to contact me via WhatsApp for further photos and videos. From an early age, the puppies are being carefully socialised in a busy household environment. They are regularly exposed to young children, including a child with additional needs, and will also be socialised with our other dog. Labradors are renowned for their friendly, loyal, and intelligent nature, making them outstanding family companions. Impressively, the puppies are already showing early signs of intelligence by using puppy pads at just two weeks old. We will also be undertaking sound desensitisation, introducing everyday household noises such as the vacuum cleaner, fireworks, and general day-to-day sounds, to help ensure the puppies grow into confident, well-adjusted dogs and reduce the risk of anxiety later in life. The mother, Narla, is our much-loved family dog. She has been raised alongside our male Golden Retriever and two children with special needs, one of whom is severely autistic. Narla has a truly outstanding temperament and shares an incredible bond with our children. She embodies everything desirable in the breed ‚Äî beauty, unwavering loyalty, intelligence, strength, and a strong heritage of devotion and skill. The father is a KC-registered stud dog, known for his excellent intelligence and strength. Photographs of the sire are included. The puppies will be ready to leave at 8 weeks of age. Each puppy will be: ‚Ä¢ Fully vaccinated ‚Ä¢ Microchipped ‚Ä¢ Provided with a puppy pack, including food, toys, and a blanket carrying the scent of their mother and littermates to help them settle comfortably into their new home To secure your chosen puppy, a ¬£300 non-refundable deposit will be required after you have viewed the puppies and are happy with your choice. Please feel free to get in touch for further information, photographs, or to register your interest.

description: Female Labrador Retriever - Black (born 2016) She comes from fully health tested parents. and Is KC Registered. description: We are reluctantly selling our beautiful 2.5 year old French Bulldog. Oscar. The reason for sale is that over the last 12 months Oscar has developed a problem with our 6 year old male Frenchie. We have 2 other dogs too (1 x male and 1 x female) and Oscar has no issue with either. We have recently had a litter of 5 puppies too and Oscar was so playful and gentle with all of them. We have tried support from a dog behaviourist but he cannot seem to let go of his issue with the older dog. Outside he is friendly when approached by other dogs, walks well off the lead (when we go to playing fields and country walks), has good recall and is crate trained. Our thoughts are that Oscar needs to be in a home either alone, or where he would be the first dog in a home before others are introduced. He has never attacked or bitten the older frenchie but he is constantly watching his every move and blocks him from playing with any toys or with the other dogs. title: Our site will be temporarily unavailable between 01:00 and 04:00 on the 21st. We apologise for any inconvenience.
description: Bordernese Puppy - female (Border Collie and Bernese Mountain Dog) - 12 weeks old (DOB 17/10/25) A very sad and reluctant sale of our recently purchased Bordernese puppy. She's a healthy 11kg and has lovely colouring - a complete symmetry of colour; predominately black but with white and ginger markings and has the floppiest ears and biggest paws!!! Bought on the 2nd January from a licenced breeder in Carmarthen (Malolgi Kennels - E.M. Roberts) (licence number: LAB107) - we can provide contact details for the breeder if necessary for clarification or you can easily find this information online. We spent months and months choosing the right puppy and right seller, but unfortunately due to our son having allergic reactions and our elderly cat becoming stressed and ill we have had to make the decision to rehome Bailey. Despite this hard decision we've decided to do it sooner rather than later before Bailey becomes to attached to us and it becomes harder for her to resettle in a new home. She came from a litter of 8 puppies and we saw Mam and Dad and the remaining litter and received a contract which the new buyer can have showing that the parents had a health check before breeding and the puppy received a health check prior to our purchasing. We saw the family that raised her and the lovely conditions they lived in. in addition to breeding dogs, they have a working farm where they breed and show livestock and clearly loved their animals. She has been microchipped and her vaccines and worming and flea treatment were up to date when we purchased her and Bailey will have her final booster injection on the 14/01/2026. She's very loving and has a lovely temperament and is very intelligent. She loves cuddles We've been working hard as a family to train Bailey and she's been taught to sit, lay down, wait, get down, and is well on the way to be toilet trained. She loves to play and has her favourite toys (which we'll provide of course) but also loves her down time. She is good at relaxing and sleeping during the day when put on her bed and at night now sleeps right through to the morning. She enjoys time in the garden, running around and exploring. She isn't bothered by loud noises; piano and musical instruments, hoovering, drilling, knocks on the door etc. she just ignores them and gets on with whatever she was doing. She's definitely not a 'barky' dog. She's loves her food and is primarily fed on Bergess Supa Dog Puppy (we'll provide any remaining food), but has been introduced to mince and also carrots and apples which are great for the teething. She also loves peanut butter on a Licky Mat. This a very reluctant and sad decision and sale; we've always wanted a puppy/dog as we're an outdoor family, but at the moment our son's health must take priority and it's important that Bailey has a loving family that can give her all the love and attention she deserves. We paid ¬£1500 just 2 weeks ago and good ¬£400+ on bedding, equipment, food, toys, injections etc. However to ensure a quick rehoming for Bailey to reduce any stress we are asking only ¬£1200 which will include all of the following as well: All remaining Bergess dog food (we've only just bought a huge 12.5kg bag) lots of treats Collar, harness, lead and car seat harness 2 large beds All her toys etc. Sheet/towels with her smell to help her resettle You'll be given a copy of the contract we had from the licenced breeder we purchased Bailey from and her vaccination record and diet/health plan - and a contract/receipt of sale from us. You're welcome to visit Bailey here and see her in her new environment and we can answer any questions you may have. Just like you'll want to see our loving home before making a decision; we're absolutely gutted and feel really guilty and will only sell if we also feel happy and confident that Bailey will be loved and cared for. I hope this provides lots of initial information, but please do get back in touch with any questions or if you would like to come around and see Bailey. We're based in Porth, CF39 9AB Many thanks Delyth and David

description: Hi there, we are sadly coming on here to list our 10 month old GSD to find him a new home. His name is Enzo and we absolutely love him to pieces, however we do have 2 border collies and the 3 dogs combined just do not get along. The 2 border collies that we have are male and female, the female tends to herd him relentlessly and the males end up having scuffles which is hard to manage for us. We are 21 and 22 years old and I (21 female) work full time and my partner (22male) works part time. We have a good schedule to ensure all 3 dogs are well exercised and are given lots of attention however recently it has been very difficult with the dogs not getting along. We want to see Enzo go to a loving home with people who will continue to put in the training with him. Enzo is very food driven which we have used to our advantage with training but it does mean you need to be firm with commands when feeding (sit, paw, wait). Enzo is a large shepherd, and he is not yet fully grown. We do have pictures of Mam and Dad from when we originally bought Enzo and they are also large GSDs, I am more than happy to send these over on request as I will have to have a little hunt for them. We feel he would thrive being an independent dog in a home with no other pets.

title: Our site will be temporarily unavailable between 01:00 and 04:00 on the 21st. We apologise for any inconvenience.
description: This is one of the hardest things I‚Äôve ever had to write. Boru is coming up to 5 years old. He‚Äôs been with me since he was a 3-month-old puppy and I am his first and only owner. He is not ‚Äújust a dog‚Äù to me ‚Äì he‚Äôs been my companion through years of life, and I love him deeply. Boru is an extremely high-energy dog. He needs constant physical and mental stimulation ‚Äì long walks, runs, play, structure, and engagement every single day. If you‚Äôre a ‚Äúwalk around the block‚Äù type of owner, this dog is not for you. He is a working dog so it be great to have someone with a need for him or constantly out and about with him. I now have a newborn baby, and my responsibilities have shifted in a way that means Boru is no longer getting the time, attention, and consistency he truly deserves. I can see that this is affecting him, and it‚Äôs not fair to ask him to adapt to a life that doesn‚Äôt suit his needs. This decision is not being made lightly or out of convenience. I‚Äôve gone above and beyond for Boru for nearly five years, but loving him also means being honest about what‚Äôs best for him long-term. I am looking for a forever home, not a quick handover. Ideally, I‚Äôd like a potential new owner to: - Visit Boru few times - Spend time walking and bonding with him - Build trust before any rehoming takes place I will not rehome him unless I‚Äôm confident he‚Äôs going to a person who understands high-drive dogs and can genuinely give him the life he deserves. If you think you could be that person, and you‚Äôre willing to take the time to do this properly, please get in touch. (He has amazing recall, knows the fundementals of sit, lay, bed, stop, out, take.. etc and very friendly to female dogs but needs to be cautious with male dogs before introducing, especially intact male dogs. He himself is intact - should not be neutered as there are very negative effects on dogs of hes breed. Staying intact keeps hes testosterone high which helps keep hes bones and muscles strong).

description: A Jackapoo (or Jackadoodle) is a popular designer crossbreed of a Jack Russell Terrier and a Poodle . known for being intelligent, energetic, playful, and affectionate companions, often with low-shedding coats, though their traits vary as they're hybrids, making them great for active families who can provide consistent training and exercise. Good with Families: They are generally good with kids and other pets if socialized early, but the terrier instinct might affect small rodents. Trainability: Their intelligence makes them trainable, but they can be stubborn. Grooming: Needs regular brushing to manage their coat, even if low-shedding. Health: Typically healthy with a life expectancy of 12-15 years, but inherit traits from both breeds. We have 2 girls and 2 boys. description: Hi, my elderly mother has been very ill whilst visiting home abroad and unfortuntly suffered life aultering ilness so will now be staying on The Philipines for the forseable future. He would be happy in a home with no children or other dogs. We have brought our children to visit so he has been around them but he gets grumpy and prefers adult company. He has been known to growl at younger children (being honest) and although has gotten on with other dogs i believe he would be most happy and suited to maybe a single person or a couple. Maybe someone retired who would like a little walking companion. He is a sweet, afrectionate and happy boy. He loves the beach. He is 9 years old otherwise healthy with no medical issues. Hes been with our family for 8 years living with my mother and sister in north sheilds. We are very sad to be saying goodbye. We are trying our best to find the most loving forever home for him and also to find his human match to live out his days and enjoy life. As a family unfortuatly we coukd not keep him as we have two year old twins and two other children under 7 (mad house!) Plus a recue labrador of our own and that would be very stressful for jimmy. He is currently in Durham homed with a foster family but they have other dogs ans children and he isnt as happy or suited to thier family so we said we would take him back and hopefully find the right home. She is very adventurous and loves all kind of weather, activities, people and other dogs. She is an all rounder! Very lucky to have had her from birth so I‚Äôve been with this dog since her first breath! She is being the best, loving, caring mumma for the pups so these pups are very well looked after by her and me. She is also 3/4 black lab and 1/4 Hungarian vizsla - I couldn‚Äôt as the mixed breed on the title. About father: He is the most loving, obedient, funny, caring husky. He is the typical Siberian husky with his quirks of talking, being silly and affectionate. He is excellent with people and other dogs. The most important ones.. the puppies: They are more husky like looking with their fluffy bodies, all black on the top half then have unique white prints on their bellies ( kinda marble like ) with either white socks/ toes or a mix of grey and white. They have just opened their eyes so awaiting eye colour. They all are walking like tanks, being loving and got some quirky personalities. They will be on a very high nutritional dried kibble to give them the best start of development. I am a very nutritional feeder to my dog as I believe that their diet makes all the difference to their mind and body. I will also do my best to get them toilet trained before they come to you. I have started early neurological development on all pups. This is a series of little interactions which help improve stimulation to overcome controlled stress. It benefits their later life situations for when things are new. This is only performed on age 3 days - 16 days as it‚Äôs a crucial time of their mind development. All pups have taken very well to it. Also, I will get them very well socialised with different experiences of interaction. I have started grooming them by cutting their nails to help mumma with feeding / to help their acceptance of toe touching / keeping their nails at a good length so you don‚Äôt need to worry about very sharp, long claws. Again, all pups have taken very well to this interaction. All pups will come with a bag of kibble, blanket, toy and have their pet medical book. More photos will be uploaded as they get older. Be the first in line to add one of these gorgeous puppies to your family! ( I have only named them for my own purposes so you can choose your own when satisfied with your fluff ball ) I will respond to any deeper conversations asap. description: Barney is a miniature dachshund born on 3 April 2023, making him 2 years and 9 months old. We have had him since he was 8 weeks old and he has been raised in a loving home environment. He is a loving, playful, and affectionate dog with a big personality. Like many sausage dogs, he is very loyal and protective of his owners and forms strong bonds with the people he trusts. He enjoys playtime, attention, and being close to his humans. Barney is good around other dogs but is not suited to a home with young children, as he can become overwhelmed by them. He would thrive best in an adult-only home or with older, dog-savvy children. He is mostly toilet trained. When he has regular access outside he does very well, but he can have small accidents if he is unable to get outdoors in time. We currently use doggy nappies during those periods, which has worked well for him. Barney needs a home where someone will be around most of the time. When left alone for long periods, he can become distressed and destructive. Sadly, our circumstances have changed and we are now working longer hours. We cannot bear the thought of him being left alone and unhappy, which is why we are making this very difficult decision. Barney is: ‚Ä¢ Fully microchipped ‚Ä¢ Fully up to date with all vaccinations and routine medication ‚Ä¢ In excellent health with no known medical issues He will come with his fully fitted harness and all relevant information. We are looking for a committed, loving home where his needs can be fully met and where he can continue to thrive. This decision has not been taken lightly, and Barney‚Äôs welfare is our absolute priority.

description: * somewhat reserved at the moment pending meetings / home checks , if you are interested please drop a message , if things do not go to plan with the family we are speaking to we will be in contact Thanks **** We have a 1yo castrated male looking for a new loving home through no fault of his own but our older dog just cannot adapt to him at all and is becoming a shell of himself We've had Gerald since 12 weeks old and he really is the most loving kind pup u could ask for .. this decision hasn't been taken lightly but it's necessary for both our household and Geralds long term happiness . They honest truths about him He loves ALL the attention ( one of the main reasons for rehoming ) we have our older dog , 3 children and 2 cats we have to divide our attentions between aswell as both working full time , he can sometimes chew things up if left lying around and unattended for long periods of time , we usually find a nice big yaker bone keeps him very occupied He has on occasion had a wee accident indoors if he is not in his crate and hasn't been let out within a cpl hours but he will generally walk to the back door to let you know he needs to go He loves his crate and will willingly take himself off to it when he knows it's bed time , or as/when needed He's very playful but doesnt understand he weighs 24kg and can't be held like a baby ! He doesn't like long walks at all .. 20 minutes at a time is more than enough He doesnt like car journeys too much they stress him out He loves his cuddly toys and a good nose scratch and has a clean bill of health. Hes recently been castrated. A decision we made to avoid a home that may have only wanted to use him to stud !! He lives with 3 children aged 5-16 and is soft as anything with them , plays well with other dogs and also loves our cats although he does like to pin them down on occasion and again weighing 24kg isnt ideal for the kitty unless they play back like ours do He comes from a brilliant blood line , is Micro chipped, up to date with vaccinations and has a diet of royal canin dry food , mixed with a raw meat diet to ensure he stays in good health and weight range He'll want to follow you everywhere you go ( yes even to the toilet if you allow it ) üòÜ The non - negotiables We will want to do a home check , to ensure a clean loving household for him , and would like to know your home dynamics to ensure it will work for Gerald. Meeting him before officially taking him is a must to make sure his excited temperament is right for you, and that he takes to you aswell . He is the main priority here and we're willing to keep him with us until the right family come along , he will not just go to anyone , anywhere .

We currently have 5 boys and two girls available Both parents are our much loved family pets so you are welcome to meet them and have some time with them, they are both sweet, loving and very playful . This is their first litter of puppies and we are not planning another, we are not professional breeders so not interested in making lots profit, but we are interested in finding people who have lots of time and love to invest? Deer-Doodles are quite rare, they offer all the cute cuddly traits and strong genetics from the poodle, that all doodles have, with the elegance and grace of the deerhound long-dog. The Deer-Doodle puppies are all black with individual splashes of white on their chests and bellies and some have some white toes, they may turn lighter over time as their mother was born black and is now silver? Both parents have coats that don‚Äôt moult or shed hair, Grace needs to be clipped every 6 weeks or so, Torren has a rough woolly coat and needs grooming a couple of times each week with a pin brush. Torren was blond as a puppy but is now silver-grey. Our puppies will be raised in our family home , with their parents, where all the commotion goes on, they will used to all household noises and smells. Each puppy will have their 1st vaccination, health check, and microchipping, they will be wormed every 2 weeks till 8 weeks old. We welcome home visits from 4weeks old (4th February) as by then they start showing their individual characters When you have chosen your boy or girl there is a ¬£350 non refundable reservation fee with the balance to be paid prior to the collection date. The puppies will leave with a blanket with mums scent on, and a puppy pack with information on their journey to date. We feed the parents on raw food diets and plan on weaning the pups to the same, as we feel that this is the most healthy option as we don‚Äôt believe in feeding dogs carbohydrates. The puppies will be ready to leave around the 4th March 2026 If you are interested or have any questions please get in touch for more information. Texting or WhatsApp is best we can then arrange a mutually convenient time for a chat? Many Thanks for your interest and we look forward to hearing from you.

description: Born on 10/12/2023. His name is Steki. We brought him home from his original family when he was around 7‚Äì8 weeks old. He originally had many siblings. He is microchipped, neutered, and vaccinated annually. He is a very lively and energetic boy. He has a bit of a husky personality; He loves to chew on toys, so when he's alone, we use a playpen or cage to keep him out of the furniture, just in case. There are children in our home, so he is used to living with kids and adapts well to a family with children. However, he is not good with other dogs. Whenever we go for walks, he shows strong aggression towards other dogs. He understands simple commands such as ‚Äúsit,‚Äù ‚Äúwait,‚Äù and ‚Äúdown.‚Äù He is very protective of the home ‚Äî when a stranger approaches the door, he will bark once as a warning. He does not bark excessively. He will only become alert when strangers approach the house, or occasionally when friends visit, as he is initially cautious with unfamiliar people. However, after a short time of playing and interaction, he becomes very friendly. We have two children and the cat at home. Steki loves playing with children, although the cat does not get along with him. His previous family also had children. He receives annual vaccinations and health checks at the veterinary clinic, and I also administer parasite prevention treatment every month. I feel very ashamed and heartbroken to let him go. description: üíõ Rottweiler √ó French Mastiff Puppies (‚ÄúRottie Bordeaux‚Äù) ‚Äì Born 24th November üíõ üí∑ ¬£850 each | ¬£150 non-refundable deposit to secure Our beautiful girl Athena has welcomed her very first litter of stunning puppies on 24th November. The puppies are a powerful yet affectionate mix of their parents, often referred to as Rottie Bordeaux, combining strength, loyalty, calm confidence, and an incredibly loving nature. These puppies are being raised inside our family home, alongside both mum and dad, and with children, so they are growing up well socialised, confident, and used to everyday household life, noises, and affection. From day one, they have been handled with love, patience, and care. About the Parents: Mother ‚Äì Athena Athena is a purebred Rottweiler from champion bloodlines. She is an exceptional example of the breed: *Calm, loving, and incredibly patient. *Naturally nurturing and gentle, especially with children. *Confident without aggression. *Intelligent, eager to please, and emotionally intuitive. Rottweilers are known for their loyalty, steadiness, and devotion to their family, and Athena truly embodies all of this. She is a wonderful mother and an amazing family dog. Father ‚Äì Thor Thor is a French Mastiff (Dogue de Bordeaux) with the biggest heart. *Insanely loyal and deeply bonded to his people. *A gentle giant who thinks he‚Äôs a lap dog. *Fantastic with children. *Protective of his family while remaining calm and stable. He may look intimidating, but he is a true softie. Relaxed, affectionate, and emotionally sensitive to those around him. His protective instincts are balanced by his calm nature, which is exactly what you want in a family guardian. Both parents are healthy, active, muscular, and well cared for, and can be seen with the puppies. About the Puppies: These puppies are already showing the best of both breeds: *Strong, chunky builds with expressive faces. *Calm but confident temperaments. *Naturally affectionate and people oriented. *Curious, alert, and intelligent. They will grow into loyal, devoted companions who form deep bonds with their families. This mix is ideal for someone looking for a dog that is both a loving family member and a natural protector. Because of their breeding, these puppies will need: *Consistent training. *Clear boundaries. *Love, time, and commitment. In return, they will give unmatched loyalty and companionship. Raised With Care & Responsibility: These puppies are not kennel raised or mass bred. They are part of our home and our daily life. Before leaving for their new homes, each puppy will: ‚úÖReceive first vaccinations ‚úÖGet microchipped ‚úÖBe health-checked Each puppy will also go home with a puppy pack, including: *A blanket with mum‚Äôs scent (to ease the transition). *Food they are used to. *A toy. This helps them settle more calmly and comfortably into their new family. A Bit About Us: I am an absolute dog person, the kind who can‚Äôt walk past a dog without saying hello. I grew up with a Staffy who meant the world to me, and when I lost that dog, I couldn‚Äôt bring myself to get another for many years. It honestly felt like cheating. Athena and Thor are my first dogs since then, and they are deeply loved members of our family. This litter has been planned, cared for, and raised with intention, love, and responsibility. Finding the right homes matters more to me than a quick sale. I want these puppies to go to people who understand the responsibility of large, intelligent breeds and who are ready to invest in training, structure, and lifelong care. Homes We‚Äôre Looking For: These puppies will be best suited to: *Loving, committed families or individuals. *Homes that understand large breeds. *Owners willing to provide training, time, and affection. If you‚Äôre looking for a dog that will grow up to be: ‚ú® Loyal. ‚ú® Protective without being aggressive. ‚ú® Incredible with children. ‚ú® A true family companion. ‚Ä¶then one of these puppies may be perfect for you.

description: Saint Bernard Cross Looking for a Special Home Pennie is a beautiful Saint Bernard cross, born 03/02/2023, and a large-breed girl who is a much-loved member of our family. She is being rehomed due to personal circumstances and not because of anything she has done wrong. Pennie is up to date with her vaccinations and microchipped, though she is not neutered. She is a very friendly, gentle dog who lives happily with children and cats. However, she would be best suited to a home where she can be the only dog, as she finds other dogs overwhelming. As you‚Äôd expect from her breed, Pennie comes with plenty of hair and some dribble, so her new owner must be prepared for that side of big-dog life. She will thrive with someone who has experience handling large breeds and understands their needs. Pennie is extremely nervous and easily frightened, and as a result she is very reactive on walks. This is something her new owner must be willing to manage patiently and compassionately, ideally with experience of anxious or reactive dogs and a calm, structured approach. Our priority is simply finding her a safe, loving, and suitable home. In line with guidelines and to ensure a clear transfer of ownership, Pennie‚Äôs microchip details will need to be updated to the new owner‚Äôs information prior to or at the time of rehoming. We will provide the microchip number so this can be done by the new owner directly; there is a transfer fee of approximately ¬£25, payable to the microchip database. We are committed to finding Pennie a safe, understanding, and experienced home where she can feel secure and loved. If you feel you could offer Pennie the right environment and the time she needs to settle, please get in touch for a chat.

description: Hello, my name is Obi-Wan and I am 12 months old, I have one blue eye and one brown eye. My coat is very fluffy, soft and completely white and I need to shed my coat every six months or so to help me acclimatise to the changing seasons. I am an intact Siberian Husky. My most favourite things to do in life is running and walking I have so much energy but I do love to nap lots during the day. I love spending time with my family and being close to people who love me. My favourite toys are balls and ropes which I enjoy playing with quietly on my own. I love attention from big children but small children scare me when they won‚Äôt leave me alone. I am a very happy husky and very friendly with lots of people and cats once I get to know them, but small doggies scare me and big male doggies are scary too. I really don‚Äôt like the dark and I hate being left on my own this makes me feel scared anxious and insecure. I love routine it makes me feel secure and safe. I am a very good boy I know that I have to ask to go outside to use the toilet and not to do this in the house. I know that I am not allowed to climb on the furniture or chew anything that isn‚Äôt my toys. üè° My home needs to be spacious with a big secure garden. üë∂ No small children, but big children are fine. üê∂ No small dogs or male dogs ‚õîÔ∏è No weed smokers or drug users. ‚õîÔ∏è No shouting, or heavy handling. I really need someone who knows about husky‚Äôs and how to train and take care of me. I will thrive from positive reinforcement and praise. I have one request please do not shout at me because you will scare me and I won‚Äôt listen to you, but if you ask me nicely and make everything exciting I will follow your commends all day long. I already know lots of commands like sit, paw, lie down, stay, leave, off, down, bed, walk, and up. I have already been through a very tough time, I have been re-homed twice before through no fault of my own. Please only agree to take me home if you have serious thought about it and you are not going to give me away again, I don‚Äôt think my heart will take it. If you give me 100% effort and love I promise to reward you a million times over. I deserve a chance and a forever home with kind and loving people. If you want to take me home you need to convince my current family that you are the best people for me and can give me a better life with you. We will be willing to discuss price for the right home.

Mum and dad are much loved family pets and are well socialised with all our children, other dogs, cats and all livestock as we live all together here on a farm. We've taken daily photos and videos of their progress and development and they have just had their first vaccinations, microchips and full health checks by a veterinary professional who was in awe of them. This is mums first litter and the dedication and care she has shown to them has been second to none, they truly are an exceptional litter. The pups have really flourished being able to play around the farm with their parents and love being able to investigate farm life especially the mud ! We' d really hope anyone interested in welcoming one of these puppies into their lives have either experienced or thoroughly researched the breed as they are huge but gentle giants and we long to match each and every one of them to their forever home.

description: Bodhi is a neutered, 2 and a half year old American Bulldog cross. Unfortunately, I am currently in a crisis and due to no fault of his own, Bodhi is looking for a new home. He has been around cats before, but due to his young age and size he gets very excitable so wouldn‚Äôt be recommended. He has never been around young children before but with some care, love, attention and boundaries, I believe he will be okay around older children (13+). I have had him since he left his litter as a young pup. He is house trained and doesn‚Äôt have accidents in the house, is up to date with all vaccinations including kennel cough. He will pull on the lead but with some time and guidance I believe this can be easily rectified. Once off the lead he is very good, he doesn‚Äôt go more than 15/20ft in front before waiting for you to catch up and will avoid other dogs if you tell him he can‚Äôt play with them. When out on his walks, his favourite thing in the world will be sticks. He does jump up the first few times with meeting people because he just wants to give lots of kisses, but when he knows he doesn‚Äôt have to fight for your attention he‚Äôs very chilled and quite a couch potato. He does well on car journeys, but the longest he‚Äôs spent on a car journey is only 30 minutes, one way. He has been very well loved and I am absolutely broken that it has come to this. title: Our site will be temporarily unavailable between 01:00 and 04:00 on the 21st. We apologise for any inconvenience.
description: It is with a heavy heart that I am looking to rehome our Cavapoo, Waffle. He's 2 1/2 years old, neutered and up to date on vaccinations and flea/worm treatment. I'll be as honest as I can here as I want his next home to be forever. We bought him from someone a year ago, not being told some of the issues he has. Overall he's a very sweet boy, loves cuddles, toys, rides in the car and walks. Unfortunately he's very reactive on meeting other dogs and despite our best efforts he's no better. He appears to be very aggressive however if anyone allows their dog next to him, within a few minutes he just wants to play, I think he's just scared of the unknown as he does have a couple of doggy friends. He's very similar with people, he tends to be very stand offish until he gets time to meet them and then he's fine. He loves to be off lead and play with a ball, however as he is the way he is we can only do this at enclosed dog spaces when he's alone so he could do with a garden to play in. Unfortunately after everything we've tried I'm just unable to cope with him out on walks and can't help but feel he'll be better off with someone who can work with him or an environment that suits him better, perhaps someone with knowledge of the breed. Any questions, please feel free to ask.
